author: Pierluigi Paganini
description: The cyberattack on UK retailer Co-op in April caused empty shelves, customer data theft, and a $275M revenue loss. In May, the cybercrime group behind the April Co-op cyberattack, who go online with the name DragonForce, told the BBC that they had stolen data from the British retail and provided proof of the data breach. […]
title: Cyberattack on Co-op leaves shelves empty, data stolen, and $275M in lost revenue
